intro: Neokochia americana, commonly known as the American kochia, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments. Neokochia americana is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
